msItem.author: John of Bury
msItem.title: Pupilla oculi
msItem.note: 24 texts, including some by Roger Walden and Bartolus de Saxo Ferrato, and copy of Edward I's Confirmation of Magna Carta, also bound with printed incunable, Bernardus de Parentis, Expositio officij missae (Strasbourg, 1487), now catalogued on SOLO. MS marginalia in printed item in later hand.

Codex membranaceus, in folio, ff. 194, sec. xv. ineuntis, binis columnis exaratus. 1. Johannis de Burgo Pupilla Oculi in partes decem Incip. "Humane condicio;" ut in edit. impress. In calce, "Explicit pupilla oculi." decem distincta, tabula capitulorum tam in principio quam in fine illustrata. fol. 3. ib. tom. i. p. 746.
2. Libellus de visitatione Infirmorum. fol. 132. Incip. "In visitacione infirmorum facienda talibus alloquatur egris sermonibus."
3. Ottonis Cardinalis Constitutiones. fol. 135. Incip. "Quoniam decet domum Domini;” ut in editt. impress.

4. Ottoboni Constitutiones, anno Domini 1268, cum glossa Johannis de Athona, etc. f. 138 b. Incip. gloss. "Mandata Dei ;" in Wilkins Concil. tom. ii. p. 1. Sequuntur constitutiones aliæ provinciales archiepiscoporum Cantuariensium; scilicet,
5. Constitutio provincialis Steph. Langton. f. 149b. Incip. "Statutum felicis;" ut in Wilkins Concil. tom. i. p. 530.
6. Bonifacii de interdicto faciendo. fol. 150. Incip. "Proinde attendentes;" cf. tom. i. P. 746. •
7. Decretum domin. Roberti et Walteri Quæ parochiani tenentur invenire.' fol. 150 b. Incip. "Inter cetera;" tom. ii. p. 280.
8. Joh. Stratford, editæ 1343. fol. 151. Incip. "Sponsam Christi ;" ib. tom. ii. p. 702.
9. Rob. Winchelsey apud Merton editæ. f. 155 b. Incip. "Quoniam propter;" tom. ii. p. 278.
10. Concilium Oxon. per Stephanum [Langton] celebratum A. D. 1216, [1222.] fol. 156. Incip. "Ex auctoritate Dei;" ib. tom.i.p.585.
11. Constitutiones Jo. Peckham apud Redyng cele- bratæ, 1279. fol. 160 b. Incip. "Audistis, fratres;" tom. ii. p. 33.
12. Ejusdem Constitutiones apud Lambeth; 1281. fol.. 162 b. Incip. "Ab exordio ecclesie;" tom. ii. p. 51. 14.
13. Simonis Mepham apud S. Paulum London. mense Februarii anno 1323 editæ. fol. 169. Incip. "Zelari oportet ;" tom. ii. p. 552.
14. Roberti de Winchelsey, anno 1305 editæ. fol. 170 b. Incip. "Presbiteri stipendiarii;" ii. p. 280.
15. Johannis Peckham constitutio de decimis et oblationibus edita London. 1280. fol. 171. Incip. "De insolucione."
16. Bonifacii edita apud Lambeth, 1261. fol. 172. Incip. "Universis sancte ;"

17. Statuta edita apud Merton per eundem de ma- teria decimarum. fol. 176. Incip. "Quoniam propter;" tom. i. p. 736. Sequitur declaratio regis Edwardi I. supra articulos Bonifacii de libertate ecclesiæ.
18. Simonis Islip do festis. fol. 180 b. Incip. "Ex scripturis;" tom. ii. p. 560.
19. Johannis Stratford, 1344 editæ. fol. 181 b. Incip. "Quoniam sit inhonestum ;" ii. p. 696.

20. Edwardi 1. Chartæ Magnæ confirmatio; cum titulis. fol. 185. 21. Ejusdem confirmatio Chartæ de Forcsta, præ- viis capitulis. fol. 187. 22. Ejusdem sententia super chartas lata A. D. 1273. fol. 188.
23. Bartholi a Saxoferrato tractatus super mate- ria famæ, et est glossa ejusdem super C. Plu- rimum in L. de minore, ff. de quæstionibus. fol. 188 b. Incip. "Venio ad materiam fame."

24. Ejusdem tractatus super materia denunciatio- nis, et est glossa ejusdem super L. Dyvus, ff. de custodia reorum. fol. 191. Incip. "Pro materia denunciationis." Sequuntur, man. sec., a. Constitutio Rob. Walden, super indictione festorum SS. Da- vid et Cedde et Wenefrede, et S. Thomæ Becket. (b.) Roberti ep. Lich. et Cov. Pro- mulgatio Simonis, ep. London. constitutionis de diebus festivis observandis.

layoutDesc.layout: Written space 230 150 , double column, written in brown ink, 56 lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: Full-page illuminated border with red and blue decoration (fol. 5r)
3-line decorative initials in blue ink with red decorative extensions, paragraph markers in red and blue.

binding.p: 18th century calf over boards with blind tooled panel design.

history.provenance: Manuscript inscription on slip of parchment tipped in: "Liber Mri Attewater emptus Lo[n]donijs p[er] Willm Menyman Colleg Whityngton Soc". William Menyman, fellow of Whittington College and editor of a homily on Mary Magdalene [?1505]. Atwater's books came to Brasenose through John Longland. Inscription on printed work reads " Thomas Lewis est possessor huius libri".

recordHist.source: Description by Sophie Floate. Previously described in H. O. Coxe, Catalogus codicum mss. qui in collegiis aulisque Oxoniensibus hodie adservantur, II (1852) [sections separately paginated], Brasenose, p. 5

listBibl.bibl: D. E. Rhodes, 'Bibliographical Notes: William Menyman and William Faques', The Library, s5-XXXI, Issue 1, March 1976, Pages 74–76 -
